subject: Re: [junit] Re: Any tools for Test Case generation?
msgSnippet: ... Why *must* there be? This ere codebase what I m working on doesn t have any such tool, and that hasn t stoped me writing testcases. [I wouldn t mind a
messageBody:
On Thursday 15 April 2004 16:04, Ranjeet Sahay wrote:
> I would like to add there must be some tool to generate atleast skeleton
> of testcases

Why *must* there be?

This 'ere codebase what I'm working on doesn't have any such tool, and
that hasn't stoped me writing testcases. [I wouldn't mind a single-biff
way of saying "make me a new subclass of the appropriate TestCase and
fill in the boilerplate and one test that says fail("not doe yet") and link it
into the local package tests", though - is that the kind of skeleton you had
in mind?]

--
Chris "electric hedgehog" Dollin
